newsitem.title: USA: Dollar General to build Mississippi distribution center.
newsitem.headline: Dollar General to build Mississippi distribution center.

text.p: Dollar General Corp., a neighbourhood store chain, said Wednesday it plans to build a $38 million distribution centre in Indianola, Miss.
The distribution centre will employ 350 people when it reaches full capacity, Dollar General said. The company's on-site trucking provider will employ an additional 125 people.
Construction is scheduled to start in the third quarter, and the centre will be fully operational in late summer 1998, the retailer said in a statement.
The 775,000-square-foot facility could be expanded to 1.5 million square feet based on distribution needs of the company, Dollar General said.
Dollar General, based in Nashville, Tenn., has about 2,700 neighbourhood stores in 24 states with distribution centres in Kentucky, Georgia and Oklahoma.
Its stock rose 44 cents to $37.44 in consolidated early affternoon trading on the New york Stock Exchange.
